api/BOOSEapp.html.title: Namespace BOOSEapp | BOOSE Project Documentation
api/BOOSEapp.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEapp Classes AppArray Represents a one-dimensional array in the BOOSE language. Supports int, real, and boolean element types. AppBoolean Represents a boolean variable declaration or assignment in the BOOSE language. AppCall Represents a method call command in the BOOSE language. AppCanvas Implements the BOOSE.ICanvas interface to provide drawing, positioning, shape rendering, and pen management functionalities for the BOOSE application. AppCircle Represents the circle command in the BOOSE language. Draws a circle on the canvas using a specified radius. The radius expression may be a literal, variable, or arithmetic expression. AppClear AppCommandFactory Factory responsible for creating BOOSE application-specific commands. Implemented as a Singleton to ensure only one factory instance exists throughout the lifetime of the application. This factory maps BOOSE language keywords to their corresponding specific command implementations. AppElse Represents the else command in the BOOSE language. The else command works in conjunction with if and end if. If the associated IF condition evaluated to TRUE, the ELSE block is skipped. Otherwise, the ELSE block is executed. AppEnd Represents the end command in the BOOSE language. AppFor Represents the for loop command in the BOOSE language. This command controls loop initialisation, iteration, and termination based on a start value, end value, and step increment. AppIf Represents the if conditional command in the BOOSE language. The condition is evaluated once when the IF is encountered. AppInt Represents an integer variable in the BOOSE language. Handles integer declaration and expression evaluation. If no expression is supplied, the variable defaults to 0. AppMethod Represents a method declaration in the BOOSE language. AppMethod.MethodParam Represents a single method parameter. AppMoveto Represents the moveto command in the BOOSE language. Moves the drawing cursor to a specified (X, Y) position on the canvas without drawing a line. AppParser Converts source lines into executable ICommand objects Performs syntax validation and structural checks Reports clear, line-based parsing errors to the user Delegates command creation to CommandFactory where appropriate AppPeek Implements the BOOSE PEEK command. Reads a value from an array at a given index Assigns the retrieved value to an existing variable AppPen Represents the pen command in the BOOSE language. Sets the current drawing colour on the canvas using RGB values. AppPoke Represents the poke command in the BOOSE language. Stores a value into a specified index of an array. AppReal Represents a real (double-precision) variable in the BOOSE language. This class preserves full floating-point precision while keeping the base BOOSE.Evaluation.Value synchronized. AppReal.CommandException Exception thrown when a real expression fails to evaluate correctly. AppRect Represents the rect command in the BOOSE language. Draws a rectangle at the current canvas position using the specified width and height. AppRect.CanvasException Exception thrown when a canvas operation fails. AppRect.CommandException Exception thrown when the command syntax or parameters are invalid. AppRect.StoredProgramException Exception thrown when the stored program is in an invalid state. AppReset AppStoredProgram This class is responsible for: Storing and executing compiled BOOSE commands Managing variables (int, real, boolean, etc.) Evaluating expressions at runtime Providing safer execution with runtime error reporting AppWhile Represents the while command in the BOOSE language. The WHILE command evaluates a condition and repeatedly executes the enclosed block while the condition remains true. AppWrite Represents the write command in the BOOSE language. Writes text to the canvas at the current pen position. AppWrite.CanvasException Exception thrown when a canvas operation fails. AppWrite.CommandException Exception thrown when the write command syntax or parameters are invalid. CanvasException Exception thrown when canvas-related issues occur Form1 The main Windows Forms interface for the BOOSE application. Provides the canvas for drawing, command input, and execution controls. myVariable Provides helper methods for converting BOOSE expressions into strongly typed C# values.

index.html.summary: BOOSE Application Documentation Welcome to the official documentation for the BOOSE Interpreter. This site contains everything you need to understand the codebase and how to use the drawing commands. Documentation Sections API Reference: Explore the classes, methods, and properties used in the project. Core Components Command Parser: Handles the logic for reading your scripts. Canvas System: The drawing engine for shapes and lines. Logic Handling: Support for While loops, If statements, and Methods. © 2026 Prapti - ASE Assignment
